title: WTA Tour
content:
{{Short description|Series of tournaments in women's tennis}} {{WTA Tour sidebar}} {{for|current season|2024 WTA Tour}} The '''WTA Tour''' is a worldwide top-tier [[tennis]] tour for women organized by the [[Women's Tennis Association]]. The second-tier tour is the [[WTA 125K series]], and third-tier is the [[ITF Women's World Tennis Tour]]. The men's equivalent is the [[ATP Tour]]. ==WTA Tour tournaments== ===Structure (2021–present)=== The WTA Tour underwent slight change in the classification of tournaments in 2021, which were reorganized on with similar nomenclature to that used on [[ATP Tour]]: *[[Grand Slam (tennis)|Grand Slam]] tournaments (4) *Year-ending [[WTA Finals]] (1) *Penultimate event [[WTA Elite Trophy]] (1) *[[WTA 1000 tournaments]] (9): ** Mandatory: Four combined tournaments with male professional players with prize money ranging from US$6.5 million to US$8.3 million. These tournaments are held in [[Indian Wells Masters|Indian Wells]], [[Miami Open (tennis)|Miami]], [[Madrid Open (tennis)|Madrid]], and [[China Open (tennis)|Beijing]]. The Beijing tournament was not held in 2021 and 2022 due to the [[Covid-19 Pandemic]] and returned in 2023. ** Non-mandatory: Five events in [[Qatar Ladies Open|Doha]]/[[Dubai Tennis Championships|Dubai]], [[Italian Open (tennis)|Rome]], [[Canadian Open (tennis)|Montreal/Toronto]], [[Cincinnati Masters|Cincinnati]], and [[Wuhan Open|Wuhan]] with prize money ranging from US$2.3 million to US$2.7 million. From 2020 to 2023, the tournament in Wuhan was suspended due to Covid–19 Pandemic. In 2022 and 2023, a new WTA 1000 tournament was held in [[Guadalajara Open Akron|Guadalajara]] as a replacement for Wuhan. *[[WTA 500 tournaments]]: 12 events with prize money from US$700,000 to US$900,000. *[[WTA 250 tournaments]]: There are nearly 30 tournaments, with prize money at US$250,000. ===Structure (2009–2020)=== The WTA Tour comprised from 2009 to the 2020 reorganization: *[[Grand Slam (tennis)|Grand Slam]] tournaments (4) *Year-ending [[WTA Tour Championships]] (1) *Penultimate event [[WTA Elite Trophy]] (From 2015 onwards) (1) *[[WTA Premier tournaments|Premier tournaments]] (21): ** Premier Mandatory: Four combined tournaments with male professional players, with US$6.5 million in equal prize money for men and women (increased from $4.5 million in 2013). These tournaments are held in [[Indian Wells Masters|Indian Wells]], [[Miami Open (tennis)|Miami]], [[Madrid Open (tennis)|Madrid]], and [[China Open (tennis)|Beijing]]. ** Premier Five: Five $2.8 million events in [[Qatar Ladies Open|Doha]]/[[Dubai Tennis Championships|Dubai]], [[Italian Open (tennis)|Rome]], [[Canadian Open (tennis)|Montreal/Toronto]], [[Cincinnati Masters|Cincinnati]], and [[Wuhan Open|Wuhan]]. ** Premier: 12 events with prize money from US$799,000 to US$2.5 million. *[[WTA International tournaments|International tournaments]]: There are 32 tournaments, with prize money for all except four events at US$250,000. The exceptions are the [[WTA Shenzhen Open|Shenzhen Open]], [[Moscow River Cup]], [[Hong Kong Tennis Open]], the [[Tianjin Open]], and the year-ending [[WTA Tournament of Champions]], each with prize money of US$750,000. ==WTA rankings== {{main|WTA rankings}} WTA publishes weekly rankings of professional players. ===Current rankings=== {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} {{P1|1={{#section:Current tennis rankings|WTA singles ranking}}}} {{col-2}} {{P1|1={{#section:Current tennis rankings|WTA doubles ranking}}}} {{col-end}} ==Ranking method== The WTA rankings are based on a rolling 52-week, cumulative system. A player's ranking is determined by her results at a maximum of 16 tournaments for singles and 11 for doubles and points are awarded based on how far a player advances in a tournament. The basis for calculating a player's ranking are those tournaments that yield the highest ranking points during the rolling 52-week period. The period must include:{{cite web |url=https://photoresources.wtatennis.com/wta/document/2021/03/08/d6d2c650-e3b4-42e7-ab2b-e539d4586033/2021Rulebook.pdf|title=2021 Women's Tennis Association Rulebook|work=Women's Tennis Association|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210502132732/https://photoresources.wtatennis.com/wta/document/2021/03/08/d6d2c650-e3b4-42e7-ab2b-e539d4586033/2021Rulebook.pdf|archive-date=2 May 2021|url-status=live}} * the four Grand Slams * the four WTA 1000 Mandatory tournaments * the best of two results among the WTA 1000 Non-Mandatory tournaments * the best of six results from the Elite Trophy, WTA 1000 tournaments, WTA 500 tournaments, WTA 250 tournaments, WTA 150 tournaments, and ITF 15s+ events * the WTA Finals as a bonus tournament if the player attended All WTA players also have a [[Universal Tennis Rating]], based on head-to-head results.
